meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of anapests.
meanings.sent1: The anapestic rhythm of the poem made it sound lively and upbeat.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style is often described as anapestic due to its light and bouncy nature.
meanings.sent3: The anapestic tone of the story brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: The anapestic beat of the music echoed through the room, filling it with energy.
meanings.sent5: The anapestic melody of the song stayed in my head long after it ended.

meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of two short or unstressed syllables followed by one long or stressed syllable.
meanings.sent1: The anapestic in the poem created a flowing and rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent2: In the line 'under the tree', 'under' is an example of an anapestic.
meanings.sent3: The anapestic in the song made it easy to tap your foot along.
meanings.sent4: His speech had an anapestic that captivated the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The anapestic in the play added a dynamic element to the dialogue.
